plugins.name: FrameSearch
plugins.description:
FrameSearch is the perfect searching tool you've been missing from Figma.


Thanks to all the comments and feedbacks from you guys, now the keyboard navigation between search results is supported! You can use both Tab or the Arrow buttons to navigate between search results and hit Enter to jump to any Frame.


Frames, Groups, and Instances are all searchable now!

-------



Please hit the like ‚ù§Ô∏è button if you find this tool to be useful! This will encourage me to improve functionality with a faster speed. LOL.


Search for any Frames across all Pages of the document.


‚Üí Launch the plugin and input the name of the Frame you are looking for.

‚Üí Don't remember the exact name? No problem! Fuzzy match is supported.

‚Üí Tap Enter to find any Frame / Group/ Instance across all Pages and jumps to the location by clicking the results.

-> You can also tap Up Arrow / Down Arrow on your keyboard to select the Last or the Next results, and hit Enter to jump and focus!

-> You can click the X icon or hit esc on your keyboard to close the window easily.

‚Üí Separate your keyword with empty space for more accurate results.



Binding keyboard shortcut: ‚åòcommand + F


By binding the exact name FrameSearch with a keyboard shortcut, you can use Command + F to launch the plugin and start searching immediately.

plugins.name: random number generator
plugins.description:
Select text layers and replace them with randomly generated numbers, lightning fast. Replace existing numbers within a text layer, reuse a custom range, disable duplicates, and format long numbers with commas.


üé• Watch demo video

Check out this quick video to see what this plugin can do!


‚ö°Ô∏è Generating numbers with quick action commands

The quickest way to use this plugin is to use Figma's quick actions menu. To open this menu on Mac, use Cmd + / or Cmd + P. On Windows, use Ctrl + / or Ctrl + P. With this menu open, you can type a command and hit enter to quickly generate random numbers.


[-] Type a valid prefix before the command

‚Ä£ g | For example: g100 / gthousand / g saved

‚Ä£ rng | For example: rng 10000 / rng million / rng saved

‚Ä£ random | For example: random10 / random hundred / randomsaved

‚Ä£ num | For example: num 1000000 / numhundredthousand / numsaved


‚Ä£ [-]10, [-]100, ... , [-]1000000

This will generate random numbers for all selected text layers between 1 and whatever amount of zeros you typed. For example, pressing Cmd + /, typing g100000, and hitting Enter will generate numbers between 1 - 100,000.


‚Ä£ [-] ten, [-] hundred, ... , [-] million

This has the same functionality as the above, but you can type the name of the number instead. For example, pressing Cmd + /, typing random ten, and hitting Enter will generate numbers between 1 - 10.


‚Ä£ [-] saved

This will generate numbers from your saved range. By default, this will be 1 through 50, but you can change it in the plugin UI. For example, pressing Cmd + /, typing rng saved, and hitting Enter will generate numbers between Custom X - Custom Y.


‚öôÔ∏è Using the plugin UI

Open up the plugin UI by navigating to it in your Plugins dropdown, or open up the quick actions menu (Cmd + /) and type rng settings. In the plugin settings window, you can do the following:


‚Ä£ Modify your saved range

Set up your minimum and maximum to generate your random numbers from. You can go really high (into the billions), so go wild. The plugin will remember this range, and you can also quickly generate new numbers from your saved range without the plugin open. See [-] saved above.


‚Ä£ Rapidly generate numbers

Keep clicking "Randomize" or hitting the Enter key and you'll regenerate numbers for all your selected text layers. Keep going until you see a set of numbers that is perfect.


‚Ä£ Toggle the "Only replace existing numbers" setting (Off by default)

Decide whether to replace the entire contents of a selected text layer with a generated number, or scan through the layer and replace any numbers found with newly generated number. Text layers without numbers in them will not be affected.


‚Ä£ Toggle the "Prevent Duplicate" setting (Off by default)

Decide whether to prevent duplicate numbers when generating numbers. This is a good way to generate unique sets of numbers or randomize list order. If the amount of numbers you are generating exceeds the amount you define in your range, the plugin will need to generate some duplicates.


‚Ä£ Toggle the "Format with commas" setting (On by default)

Decide whether to show commas for numbers above 999. For example, you'd want to toggle this on if you're generating regular numbers, but you might want to toggle it off if you're generating numbers for a data centric UI or a random list of years (2021 vs 2,021).


‚òïÔ∏è Support the plugin

If you love the plugin and feel inclined to provide some small financial support to encourage the development of new features and bug fixes, that would be greatly appreciated. No pressure, of course!

Buy me a coffee


_

accepted.name: Dan Araujo
accepted.description:
Product Designer and Creator
Currently Head of Product at Subtext

plugins.name: Export Options
plugins.description:
Export settings inheritance and more: an easy-to-use plugin that makes setting up export options for nodes super easy.


Commands

  1. iOS -> Applies all iOS specific export settings (1x, @2x, @3x) for the selected nodes.
  2. Android -> Applies all Android specific export settings (hdpi, xhdpi, xxhdpi, xxxhdpi) for the selected nodes.
  3. SVG, PDF -> Applies vector export settings for the selected nodes.
  4. Web -> Applies web specific vector export settings (1x, @2x and SVG) for the selected nodes.
  5. iOS + Android + Vector -> Applies all iOS, Android and vector export settings for the selected nodes.
  6. Remove -> Removes export settings for the selected nodes.
  7. ‚ú® Apply export options for instances: -> Figma doesn't do this automatically, but with this command you can globally set export settings to all instances based on their main component. No selection is needed.


Crafted with love at Halcyon Mobile

plugins.name: Palettes
plugins.description:
Generate and manage color styles based on perceptually uniform palettes.


Think of Palettes as your color style manager. Open it next to the Properties Panel and add a new color to start seeing new styles being created live.


‚Ä¢ Control how many shades are generated per color by changing the number of steps

‚Ä¢ Live preview shows you a grid of all color styles as you edit them

‚Ä¢ Palettes keeps track of all styles it creates across sessions, so you can edit them any time


Perceptual uniformity

The plugin aims to generate perceptually uniform palettes by default. That means that at any given percentage, you can expect different hues to have a similar relative luminance.


However, keeping luminance uniformity across hues makes it difficult to create the vibrancy levels you might expect.


You can overload the saturation control by up to 300% by using the input field to generate more vibrant colors above 100%. Keep in mind this can introduce unintended chromatic differences in a palette if you push it too far, so approach with care.

accepted.name: Henrique Gusso
accepted.description: Design Tooling at Wise

plugins.name: FigVision (Beta) - AI Image to Design
plugins.description:
üì∑ Turn a screenshot Into Full Auto-layout Responsive Components.


Gone are the days of manually recreating screenshots into Figma designs. You can now transform any screenshot into fully editable and responsive components with just a few clicks.


üß† Accurate AI to Figma Properties Conversion.


Our AI technology ensures high-fidelity conversion, maintaining the integrity of your original design. Forget about widths with decimals and truncated artboards. We ensure auto-layout perfection, so you can focus on creating, not building.


‚öôÔ∏è Responsive Components for web and mobile?


Our AI model is currently optimized for Web layouts. We know that Mobile is the most demanded feature and we are working hard to adapt our AI to it as soon as possible.


Toggle ON our ‚ÄúResponsive‚Äù feature and it will create components with web and mobile min-width properties automatically applied to all compatible layers. You won‚Äôt ever need to think about building the components for different viewports.


üìê Build Your Own Design Systems


Remember when you were wondering if you‚Äôd pay $250+ for a pre-built design system? Now you can build your own for a fraction of the price. Just upload the elements you need and turn them into usable Figma components.
plugins.tagline: Transform images into auto-layout responsive components using AI.

Background Patterns is a Figma plugin that lets you browse over 425 different figma templates that are specifically designed to be used as background patterns or SVG background patterns. These backgrounds are diverse and can be used to add backgrounds to web page or mobile dsigns.


Each SVG pattern is open sourced and can be used for personal and commercial purposes, and is free.


üëãüèª First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required
  2. All background patterns can be used for your personal and commercial projects


ü•ß Incredibly easy to use:

  1. There's nothing complicated here: browse through them and find the background pattern you're looking for
  2. Or, choose a category to filter the background templates by that category
  3. Then, just click on the pattern template (or drag the pattern over)


ü§π‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Categories:

  1. Abstract background patterns
  2. Shape background patterns
  3. Geometric background patterns
  4. Basic background patterns
  5. Other background patterns
  6. Gradient background patterns


ü§î More:

plugins.name: Snap to Grid
plugins.description:
Helper with which it is even easier to arrange elements on the grid!

When the plugin works, the canvas elements will snap to the grid when moving/scaling.

How to use:
1. Launch the plugin and click on the launch icon (top, right).
2. Indicate the size of the grid.
3. Done! By dragging the canvas elements you will notice that they snap to the cells.

‚ö† To work, the plugin must be running!

I recommend working with the grid enabled so that the result is clearer.

plugins.name: GridGen | Automatic Table Generator
plugins.description:
Utilizes built-in Figma rectangles, lines, and texts to generate tables with neatly organized layers.


How-To Use:

‚Ä¢ Select one of three constraint modes (keyboard shortcuts added):

‚Ä£ Cell and table size ("Alt + 1")

‚Ä£ Count and cell size ("Alt + 2")

‚Ä£ Count and table size ("Alt + 3")

‚Ä¢ Modify the values in the textbox and the checkboxes

‚Ä¢ "Create" to generate table, or "Cancel" to exit

‚Ä¢ Supports both mouse and keyboard navigations:

‚Ä£ "Tab" to go to next input

‚Ä£ "Shift + Tab" to go to previous input

‚Ä£ "Arrow" keys on textboxes to increase/decrease by 1

‚Ä£ "Shift + Arrow" keys on textboxes to increaes/decrease by 10

‚Ä£ "Enter" on checkboxes to toggle

‚Ä£ "Enter" on buttons to click

‚Ä£ "Shift + R" to reset input to cached values, if any

‚Ä£ "Shift + C" to initiate table creation

‚Ä£ Shortcuts to switch between constraint modes (see above)


Current Capabilites:

‚Ä¢ Supports up to 100 rows and columns

‚Ä¢ Supports table up to 5000px by 5000px (width by height)

‚Ä¢ Supports 3 constraint modes (with keyboard shortcuts)

‚Ä£ Cell and table size

‚Ä£ Count and cell size

‚Ä£ Count and table size

‚Ä¢ Enhanced UI experience with validations and loader

‚Ä¢ With/without headers, and ability to specify header height

‚Ä¢ When header is included, specify with/without floating filters

‚Ä¢ Supports striped tables

‚Ä¢ Ability to select both primary and striped colors of the table

‚Ä¢ With/without borders, and ability to define border color

‚Ä¢ Automated population of content and header texts

‚Ä¢ Specify fonts family and style based on list of installed fonts

‚Ä¢ Specify table and header font sizes

‚Ä¢ Caching and preloading of last input

‚Ä¢ Resetting to last cached input upon changes

‚Ä¢ Integrated color picker for customizable colors


Work-in-Progress:

‚Ä¢ Other units besides pixel


Other feature suggestions are welcome!


Note:

‚Ä¢ "GridMod" is approved! If you've been wanting a tool to help you modify your GridGen tables, it's now available :)

accepted.name: Stevanus Satria
accepted.description: Tweak . Tune . Tinker

plugins.name: Animate on Path
plugins.description:
How to use:

  1. Select the object you wish to move, like Frame, Instance, Shape, etc
  2. Select the curve you wish to follow. Curves can be a line via the pen tool. In case of issues, try flattening the curve.


Example on this figma file. Duplicate the file to play around. If you wish to add you fun examples to this file, email me.


Known issues:

  • Straight lines as curves do not work.
  • Curve paths, which have gaps in them, do not work
  • Objects or paths that have rotation do not work well.
  • I would really appreciate it if you could share any additional issues by emailing a video or commenting.


Future updates:

  1. Move duplicate objects on the same path. Similar to a train.
  2. Text moving along a path.
  3. Editing without closing the plugin.
  4. Ease In/Out, custom easing support


To request a change of priority or additional features, comment/email. I reply quickly.


Credits:

  • This plugin won't be possible without referring to the "To Path" plugin. üôè
  • I learned a little coding just to make this plugin, which wouldn't have been possible without my friends Kulshreshta and Piyush.
  • Shoutout to Chatgpt: Figmo, Claude for code help.
plugins.tagline: Create path animation in 2 clicks

plugins.name: Figma to JSON
plugins.description:
Figma to JSON streamlines text extraction from your Figma designs into clean, structured JSON. By following a simple naming convention in the Layers panel (key=, value=, type=component), you can define text keys, multi-language values, and reusable components. Easily generate JSON and filter results for unique values or exclude components‚Äîall in just a few clicks!


üìù How to Use:

Name Text Layers Correctly:

1. Use this pattern:

key={text_name},value=,type=component

Example:

key=button_text_login,value=,type=component key=header_welcome,value=en=Welcome,th=‡∏¢‡∏¥‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏µ‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö

2. Define Values: If value= is left empty, the plugin will use the text from the design.

3. To store multiple languages: Example: value=en=Login,th=‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏™‡∏π‡πà‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ö‡∏ö

4. Mark Components (Optional): Add type=component to tag frequently used text. During JSON export, you can filter out components if needed.

5. Generate JSON: Click "Gen JSON" to create a JSON output based on your settings.

6. Copy JSON: Click "Copy JSON" to copy and use it in your project.


‚≠êÔ∏è Tips

- Always start with key

- After the key, you can put any variable.

- You can add values for variables next to the equal sign.

- If the variable next to the equal sign is empty. The value is the same as the text in Figma.

plugins.name: Style Lens
plugins.description:
Style lens surfaces all the fills, fonts, strokes, shadows, blurs, radii, and text you‚Äôre using across your page and lets you quickly make broad sweeping changes to all the layers at once. It‚Äôs like the inspector... but in reverse.






Here are some examples of when Style Lens comes in handy:





üëâ Changing accent or brand colors across thousands of layers.





üëâ Making copy changes across large UX flows





üëâ You want to verify your file isn‚Äôt using colors, styles, or text that is incorrect





üëâ You forgot to make components early on üòÖ






Known Issues:



- Gradients aren‚Äôt currently supported



- Mixed properties will get overwritten (ex: multiple corner radii)



- When changing text, rich text won‚Äôt be preserved

plugins.name: Page Capture
plugins.description:
Page Capture makes it effortless to capture full-size webpage screenshots directly within Figma, giving you a powerful tool to enhance your design workflow.


Getting started is quick and easy:

  1. Enter the website's URL (make sure it starts with "https").
  2. Choose a custom width for your screenshot (any value between 320px and 1920px).
  3. Click the "Create a screenshot" button to capture your webpage.


With the Basic Plan, you can now take up to 20 screenshots per month for free.

Start capturing screenshots today and elevate your design process!


Need help or found a bug? Feel free to reach out at nick@pluginfactory.net.

plugins.name: Desi Ipsum
plugins.description:
Plugin to generate random placeholder text in Indian languages.


Select all the text layers you want to add text to and click 'Generate'. Each layer will be filled with a block of unique text.


What is Desi?

'Desi' is a derived word from Sanskrit 'Desa/Desam' (‡§¶‡•á‡§∂/‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç), which means country. It is generally used to describe the people, culture, languages, and products of Indian origin.


Currently supports 11 languages

  1. Hindi
  2. Marathi
  3. Sanskrit
  4. Tamil
  5. Kannada
  6. Telugu
  7. Malayalam
  8. Gujarati
  9. Bangla
  10. Odia
  11. Punjabi


Features

  1. Generates requested number of words, sentences or paras.
  2. Language-specific punctuation marks


Workflow

  1. Run plugin
  2. Select one or more text layers where you want to add generated text
  3. Enter the number and select type of text blocks such as Words, Sentences, or Paragraphs
  4. Select the language from the dropdown list
  5. Click on 'Generate' to add 'Desi Ipsum' text to your canvas

plugins.name: Copypasta - paste in place
plugins.description:
A multi-layer to multi-frame paste in place tool that respects layer index. Select any number of layers from multiple frames and duplicate that selection to multiple frames simultaneously.

Copypasta can be used by multiple people at the same time.


How to use Copypasta üçù

  1. Run plugin;
  2. Select one or more layers nested in one or multiple frames;
  3. Press ‚ÄúSave selection‚Äù;
  4. Select one or multiple target frames;
  5. Press ‚ÄúDuplicate layers‚Äù;
  6. The original selection of layers will be duplicated across the selection of target frames.


The plugin has 3 settings:

  1. Respect layer index: If switched on, the plugin will paste duplicate layers in the same index as their source (e.g. if the bottom layer of frame A is copied, it will be pasted at the bottom of frame B;
  2. Select duplicate layers: If switched on, the plugin will automatically select all new layers after a successful duplication;
  3. Keep window open: If switched on, the plugin window will remain open after a successful duplication. The last valid source selection remains saved and can be duplicated to a new selection of target frames.


Use Cases üî®

  1. (Multi) Paste in place by respecting the original layer index;
  2. (Multi) Paste in place even in X and Y values larger than the frame dimensions;
  3. Place repetitive elements in a mockup of a website;
  4. Spread updates across screens in a app mockup;
  5. Quickly iterate new proposals;
  6. Merge content;
  7. Anything else you find it useful for!


In Detail üîé

  1. Any type of layer can be duplicated;
  2. Only layers nested in a Frame, Main Component, or Instance are considered by the plugin;
  3. If a Main Component is selected it will be duplicated as an Instance;
  4. A Main Component can be selected as a target frame. An Instance cannot;
  5. The original and target frames can differ in dimension;
  6. The currently saved selection can only be overwritten by a new valid selection;
  7. The operation time will increase if a large amount of layers and target frames are selected.
  8. The plugin only duplicates the layers when pressing ‚ÄúDuplicate layers‚Äù. Any change applied to the original selection after pressing ‚ÄúSave selection‚Äù will be duplicated. Any deleted layer will not be found by the plugin;
  9. The plugin will measure the success of the operation by showing how many layers weren‚Äôt found, and how many were duplicated inside and outside the bounds of the target frames.


‚ù§ Copypasta? Buy me a coffee!
plugins.tagline: Copy a selection of layers and paste in-place in multiple frames (while respecting layer index).

plugins.name: ComponentsGPT
plugins.description:
Introducing ComponentsGPT, the Figma plugin that revolutionizes the way designers and developers work together. Seamlessly integrating with your Figma environment, ComponentsGPT is your on-the-go tool for transforming design concepts into ready-to-use code with the power of GPT-4 and Figma's robust APIs.


Whether you're sketching out the next big thing in design mode or fine-tuning details in dev mode, ComponentsGPT effortlessly translates your visual components into production-grade code. With a deep understanding of component properties, this plugin extracts precise information to ensure that the generated code mirrors the intricacies of your design.


Supporting a variety of popular frameworks including Angular, React, Vue.js, and Svelte, ComponentsGPT offers a versatile solution for teams looking to streamline their workflow. The intuitive codegen mode empowers you to generate code snippets for individual components with just a layer selection. However, wield this feature with care ‚Äì each selection initiates an API call, making efficiency your ally.

plugins.name: Circular Clone
plugins.description:
Circular Clone allows you to arrange clones of objects on your Figma canvas along a circular shape. You can control the number of segments, width, and rotation angle of the circular shape as well as the angle of rotation of the cloned objects.


Usage:


  • Select the object you want to duplicate, then activate the Circular Clone plugin.
  • Adjust the number of segments, set the circle's radius, and define the initial rotation angles to match your requirements.
  • Click the "Generate" button to create the circular arrangement.


If you have multiple elements to clone, group them into a frame before using the plugin.


To create an arc or a semi-circle shape instead of a full circle, simply input the desired rotation angle in the "Rotation Angle" field.


Special thanks Akshay for the UI design and Hashim for the UI tweaks.

accepted.description: Product & Design

plugins.tagline: Arrange clones of objects on your Figma canvas along a circular shape and control it's parameters.

71162.name: Circular Clone
71162.description:
Circular Clone allows you to arrange clones of objects on your Figma canvas along a circular shape. You can control the number of segments, width, and rotation angle of the circular shape as well as the angle of rotation of the cloned objects.


Usage:


  • Select the object you want to duplicate, then activate the Circular Clone plugin.
  • Adjust the number of segments, set the circle's radius, and define the initial rotation angles to match your requirements.
  • Click the "Generate" button to create the circular arrangement.


If you have multiple elements to clone, group them into a frame before using the plugin.


To create an arc or a semi-circle shape instead of a full circle, simply input the desired rotation angle in the "Rotation Angle" field.


Special thanks Akshay for the UI design and Hashim for the UI tweaks.
71162.tagline: Arrange clones of objects on your Figma canvas along a circular shape and control it's parameters.

plugins.name: FigDart - Flutter Styles
plugins.description:
FigDart is the bridge between Figma and Flutter, designed to boost your development speed and streamline your workflow. Our plugin allows you to effortlessly convert Figma styling properties into reusable Dart code, ensuring a seamless transition from design to development.


Say goodbye to manual code translation and keep your design and code in sync with FigDart. Additional capabilities such as converting Figma components to Flutter widgets are in the works, so stay tuned!"


Instructions

Step 1:

Install the FigDart plugin via the Figma Plugin Store.

Step 2:

Open the Figma design containing associated text styles.

Step 3:

Click on the FigDart plugin icon and choose the 'Generate Text Styles' , 'Generate Colors' or 'Generate Effects' option. The converted Dart code will be presented in the result area, ready to be copied to your Flutter project.


Additional Links/Resources

  • YouTube Video Link: A comprehensive tutorial to help you get started with FigDart.
  • Website Link: Visit our website for FAQs and more detailed information.


How to Reach Out and Support

  • Twitter
  • Github
  • LinkedIn


Want to report an issue?

Is this plugin buggy? Do you want to file a feature request? Submit an issue here.
plugins.tagline: Convert figma styles to flutter

plugins.name: Spinner
plugins.description:
V0.2 release notes at bottom


A beta version of a digital spinner plugin for wheel-based games.


Use with our community spinner template to add a spinner to your game!


Directions for use

  1. Create an group to be spun named @spinner
  2. When your user opens the spinner plugin, pressing the spin the wheel button will spin the @spinner group randomly between -180 and 180 degrees.


Think about the logic of your spinner!

If you are spinning the wheel object itself you'll probably need a locked stopper element to put on top of your spinner to determine where the wheel "lands". Alternatively, you could also spin an arrow object on top of a locked spinner. Your choice! You can use our community template to help make your spinner.


V0.2 ------

  • Added links to help and instructions inside the plugin UI.

plugins.name: css-tailwind-codegen
plugins.description:
This plugin generates tailwind CSS class names by using the CSS provided by Figma. No AI or login is needed.


The source code is available on Github


How to use


1. Toggle the dev mode in Figma

2. Go to pulgins and select css-tailwind-codegen

3. Select the layers you want to generate the class names for


Features

- Generates class names for the selected layers

- Ignore specific fields

1. Click on Inspect Settings and select Ignore Fields

2. Type the property name you want to ignore

3. You can also specify a value with the property name to only ignore this field when it has a specific value

4. Click Save and done
plugins.tagline: Generated tailwind class names from the css privided by figma

plugins.name: Blazy
plugins.description:
Blazy Figma plugin


Say goodbye to the challenges of motion design and embrace the power of Blazy, the ultimate Figma plugin that transforms your static designs into stunning animations with ease.


Leave behind the time-consuming struggle of manual animation editing. With Blazy, transform your designs into engaging animations instantly, eliminating the need for complex timelines.


Check out Blazy templates.


  • Advanced Mode: Tailored for users who demand intricate control and sophistication in their Figma animations.
  • Basic Mode: A user-friendly approach for straightforward animation additions.
  • Timeline and Keyframes: Create complex animations with multiple elements and control them using the timeline.
  • Dev Mode: Get CSS/React code for your animated elements.
  • Animation Presets: Access a library of 40+ animation presets for quick and easy animation creation.
  • Animation Timing: Fine-tune animation timing with easing controls and looping options.
  • Custom Properties: Add custom properties like opacity, scale, rotation, and more to your elements for unique animations.
  • Triggers: Assign triggers to keyframes to initiate animations on hover, click, drag, and more.
  • Saved Presets: Save your keyframe animations as presets for future use.
  • Text Animations: Create fully customizable text animations with Blazy's text splitting feature.


For more information and support, visit blazy.studio.

accepted.name: Orkhan Jafarov
accepted.description: Sr. Frontend Engineer @ Amazon

plugins.tagline: Ultimate Figma plugin to animate your prototype in one click

plugins.name: Spreadsheet Sync
plugins.description:
üß© Use dynamic data on your Figma from Google Spreadsheets.

üî• Fast data replace from Google Spreadsheet.

üòé Use Google Sheets as dynamic data on your design.

‚úÖ Works with Components, Frames, Layers... all (as long as the layer has sub-layers/children).


‚¨áÔ∏è ‚¨áÔ∏è ‚¨áÔ∏è CHECK THE STEPS BELOW ‚¨áÔ∏è ‚¨áÔ∏è ‚¨áÔ∏è


Not affiliated with Google ‚Ä¢ Created with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Andr√© Pinto


If you want to support the continued development of this plugin, why not buy me a coffee at:


ko-fi.com/apinix


SHARE THIS IF YOU LOVE IT! LETS MAKE THE BEST PLUGIN TO HELP THE COMMUNITY!


--------


STEP 1:

Your Google Spreadsheet has to be public

  1. Share > Get shareable link


STEP 2:

Use the correct naming on your Figma layers.

AUTO RENAMING... Rename manually or use the new renaming by clicking on the table (when on advanced mode).

MANUALLY RENAMING... add a # prefix followed by the name of the column you want to sync (ex: #Title).

You can nest multiple columns in one layer (Note: it is not case sensitive, and will ignore spaces).

Google Sheets column example names: (ex: Sheet / Figma)

  1. Text (Just text)
  2. Fill Color (/#E24A08)
  3. Stroke Width and Color (/2|#E24A08) or (/|#E24A08)
  4. Show (/Show)
  5. Hide (/Hide)
  6. Image (http://image-path...)
  7. Multiple (#Name#Color#Show)
  8. Multiple with Placeholders (layer name: #Value1#Value2 -> actual text: 'This is {#Value1} and is in the same sentence of {#Value 2}')


Google Sheets example:

| Title | Variant | Fill Color | Stroke | Hidden | Image |
| --------------- | ----------- | ---------- | ---------- | ------- | ----------------- |
| This is a title | Color=blue | /#ff0000 | /2|#ff0000 | /Show | http://image-path |
| This is a text | Color=green | /#0099ff | /|#0099ff | /Hide | http://image-path |


Figma layer naming example:

| ------------------------ |
| #Title | -> normal text replace
| ------------------------ |
| #Color.randsave | -> gets a random value from a random "saved" row (if you want to use the same random row on another layer)
| ------------------------ |
| #Hidden | -> hides or shows layer
| ------------------------ |
| #Image.rand | -> gets a random value
| ------------------------ |
| #Title.1#Color.randsave | -> text replacement and the same random saved color from before (if under the same selection))
| ------------------------ |



STEP 3:

Paste your Google Spreadsheet link (copy from browser address bar), select the amount of layers and click Sync.


EXTRA:

üî•üî•üî• Use the "Preview" button for an advanced usage (little blue button with eye icon next to the url input).

  1. You can rename layer(s) with just a click
  2. You can even multiple rename layers if you click SHIFT key


--------


EXAMPLES:

  1. Figma File
  2. Google Spreadsheet (example card)
  3. Google Spreadsheet (example table)
